SEARCH
Module org.klojang.jdbc
Package org.klojang.jdbc

Class SQLExpression

java.lang.Object
org.klojang.jdbc.SQLExpression
public final class SQLExpression extends Object

A special string wrapper object whose type signals to Klojang JDBC that the wrapped string must be treated as a native SQL expression and hence must not be escaped or quoted. An instance of SQLExpression is obtained through SQL.expression(String). An SQL expression could be, for example:

  • a SQL function call like CONCAT(FIRST_NAME, ' ' , LAST_NAME)
  • an operation like (SALARY * 1.05)
  • a number constant like 42
  • an already properly escaped and quoted string literal like 'Chicago O''Hare International Airport'

SQL expressions will be injected as-is into SQL statements. Use a Quoter, SQLSession.quoteValue(), or SQLSession.quoteIdentifier() to escape and quote elements within the expression if necessary.

(Although you could, it would be overblown to wrap a plain number into a SQLExpression. Numbers will anyhow not be quoted by Klojang JDBC. See Quoter.quoteValue().)
